body_html:
@mrry I think there is no dump, because it is not a crash of process.
in tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_session.cc line 186:
TF_RETURN_IF_ERROR(RunProto(&call_options, &req, &resp));
The process failed on this point and raise a Unavailable Error then exit.

If you want to investigate the potential problem of the grpc, I can give you the code package, which can 100% re-raise the problem, by setting up a 2 worker and 1 ps cluster, of which worker 0 will always fail if we use 3*512 or bigger size.
The code is modified from rnn/translate, with model unmodified and some extra cluster code.

Of course there might be some other causes, such as using VMs environment, no GPU or some codes in rnn/translate are not fit for cluster.

body:
@mrry I think there is no dump, because it is not a crash of process. 
**in tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_session.cc line 186: 
TF_RETURN_IF_ERROR(RunProto(&call_options, &req, &resp));**
The process failed on this point and raise a Unavailable Error then exit. 

If you want to investigate the potential problem of the grpc, I can give you the code package, which can 100% re-raise the problem, by setting up a 2 worker and 1 ps cluster, of which worker 0 will always fail if we use 3*512 or bigger size. 
The code is modified from rnn/translate, with model unmodified and some extra cluster code. 

Of course there might be some other causes, such as using VMs environment, no GPU or some codes in rnn/translate are not fit for cluster.
